result.execSummary:
The defendant Rickey D Black was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Fine and Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Restitution in the amount of $220.00 paid directly to the Clerk of Court's Office prior to sentencing.  The 10% surcharge in the amount of $22.00 still due and owing - same repayment conditions apply as noted for the Fine.

DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. The Court will require that no later than November 1, 2016, Defendant is to make arrangements in the State of Florida for a DNA sample to be taken with Defendant being responsible for all costs associated with making sure the sample is properly taken and forwarded to the State of Wisconsin.

Uncharged Referral for the offense of Bail Jumping with an Offense Date of 7/1/2015 is also dismissed and read-in.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rickey D Black

defendant.name: Black, Rickey D
defendant.address: 4300 E Bay Dr, Lot 225, Clearwater, FL 33764

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Overpayment Refunded to Defendant - Ck No 011338

Case Called @ 1:13 PM: Defendant Rickey D Black in court, appearing via telephone, with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow, appearing in person.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA recommends $300 find plus Court Costs - Restitution has been PIF.  From the State's perspective Deferred SEH Agreement in compliance.  Atty Zamzow joins in State's requests in light of successful agreement.  Court entertains waiver of personal appearance today with Defendant.  Court accepts Def's voluntary waiver of personal appearance today.  Statement prior to SEH by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  Accepts Joint Recommendation - Restitution of $220 ordered, already paid; Fine of $300 plus all Court Costs - bond to be applied with 60 DTP or PP;  As to DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Defendant now resides in Florida and has no future plans to return to State of Wisconsin.  Court will require that no later than 11/1/2016, Defendant is to make arrangements in the State of Florida for a DNA sample to be taken with Def being responsible for all costs associated with making sure the sample is properly sent to Wisconsin.  Also an option for Def to return to WI and provide the sample here would also be an option, though Court is hopeful the distance of travel to WI will not be required.  Appeal Rights Forms and Order to Provide DNA Sample given directly to Atty Zamzow.
from Atty Zamzow with attached restitution payment
from Atty Zamzow, Dated 5/25/2016 Re: Telephone Appearance for SEH Hrg on 8/2/2016
Sentencing hearing on August 2, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 11:20 AM: Defendant Rickey D Black in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per ADA:  Resolution will call for a 12 Mos Deferred SEH Agreement.  Upon successful completion the State will argue for a $300 Fine plus Court Costs.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Plea colloquy entertained.  Per ADA:  Uncharged Read-In with Offense Date of 7/01/2015 for BJump to be DRI - Court will consider uncharged Read-In at the time of sentencing in the future.  Collateral consequences explained.  Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of Deferred SEH Agreement. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court accepts terms and conditions of Deferred SEH Agreement.  Matter stayed for 12 mos.  Def advised to keep COC aware of any changes to his address.  Bond to continue in current format as previously ordered.  Atty Zamzow argues for bond modification and the Court deletes the prohibition as to leaving the State of Wisconsin.   Def to provide DNA sampe today. Procedure to expunge DNA sample explained to Defendant thru DOJ.

ADDRESS INFO for Rickey D Black
Current: 4300 E Bay Dr, Lot 225, Clearwater, FL 33764 United States  (Effective: 07-27-2015)
Prior: 233 E Chicago Rd, Wautoma, WI 54982

Pre-trial conference at 07-15-2015 10:45 am.
Status conference at 07-27-2015 11:15 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is not to leave the State of Wisconsin.

1:15 pm case called. Defendant Rickey D Black in court, in custody, appears via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 10:45 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 11:15 am.
